PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Ansco Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Jimmy Window, 935 Adelaide Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 18, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you think that refuse drivers and collectors should be tipped at Christmas time? Is service affected if they are not?" answer reads: "Yes, I think that they should be taken care of because they take care of your yard and see that the paper and dirt are picked up in summer.  Therefore, when they come in I give them a little tip.  Regardless of whether there's a tip or not, they act the same."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Jimmy Window wearing fedora and herringbone overcoat, standing on sidewalk of street with automobiles on left, and buildings with storefronts and signs on the right, some which read "Light..." and "Lady... Ice Cream..."
